awd_titl_txt: Seismotectonics of Southeastern China and Burma: A Case     Study in Three Dimensional Crustal Deformation Due to       Continental Collision
awd_abstract_narration: In this joint proposal between New Mexico State University                 (Dr. James Ni) and The University of Arizona (Dr. Terry Wallace)                we request funds for a detailed seismotectonic study of the                     regions around the Burma Syntaxis and intraplate mountain belts in              eastern Asia.  It is in pursuit of the principles governing                     continental deformation that this study is aimed.  We are                       particularly interested in finding out the extent of strain                     occuring at various crustal levels in the compressed continental                crust; the geometry of the Burma Benioff zone and its relationship              to the overriding southeast Asian plate.
